lines.text: Hello?
Is this the Cocksucker residence?
God damn you! Stop calling here!
Is this Four Two One Five Pussy Way?
You bitch!
Now let me check the ZIP code. Two-one-two-fuck-you?
The police are tracing this call this very minute.
Well, Dottie Hinkle, then why aren't they here, huh, fuckface?
FUCK YOU!
[hangs up]
Hahahaha!
[immediately calls her back]
DIDN'T I JUST SAY FUCK YOU?

[in a different voice]
I beg your pardon?
Who is this?
Mrs. Wilson from the telephone company. I understand you're having problems with an obscene phone caller?
Yes, I am. I'm sorry, Mrs. Wilson. But this is driving me crazy! I've had my number changed twice already. I'm a divorced woman, please help me.
Well what exactly does this sick individual say to you?
I can't say the words out loud, I don't use bad language.
Oh well, I know it's difficult but we need to know the exact words.
I'll try. Cocksucker, that's what she calls me.

[reverting to the original voice]
LISTEN TO YOUR FILTHY MOUTH, YA FUCKIN' WHORE!
GODDAMN YOU!
MOTHERFUCKER!
COCKSUCKER!
I'm so happy I could shit.
Chip, you know how I hate the brown word.

[to Detective Pike]
I tell you right there I saw blood on the bottom of her shoes, not exactly blood, it was gore, hanging there like a runny nose.
So you admit you just lied?
No I don't, you bitch!
Watch your mouth Mrs. Hinkle.
[Beverly whispers "fuck you" to Dottie]
Did you see that? She just said "Fuck you" to me!
Let the records show I'm merely standing here!
Fuck you too, you whore!
He killed people, mom.
We all have our bad days.
Mom, are you a serial killer?
The only "serial" I know anything about is Rice Krispies.
[Juror #8 is talking on a payphone when Beverly grabs the receiver from her]
You can't wear white after Labor Day!
That's not true anymore.
Yes it is! Didn't your mother tell you? Now you know.
[she whacks her in the face with the phone]
No! Please! Fashion has changed!
No... it hasn't.
[she hits her again]
Mrs. Hinkle, are you insane?
No I'm not, you motherfucker!
Are those pussywillows?
Dried ones. Aren't they pretty?
What did you just say?

[in the stalker voice]
Pussywillows, Dottie!
Will you believe that god damn litter bugger?
I have told her and told her. It takes ninety to a hundred years for a tin can to decompose, and she still won't recycle.
Cost the tax payers millions of dollars last year. But she don't care nothing about the national budget!
I hate Mrs. Ackerman.
I hate her too.
I hate her guts. You know, somebody ought to kill her.
Yeah, give her a happy face, and then recycle her.
For the sake of this planet, someone just might.
Do you think I need a lawyer?
You need an agent.
Jesus said nothing to condemn capital punishment as he hung on the cross, did he?
No.

If ever there was a time to go on record against the death penalty, wasn't it that night? Capital punishment is already the law in the state of Maryland. So what are we waiting for, fellow Christians? Let's just do it.
Amen.

[to her family after she squashes a fly with a fly swat]
Scrambled eggs anybody?

[upset after learning her mother may be a serial killer]
Now I'll never get a boyfriend!
Beverly, I've read all about this. Is it menopausal?
Oh, honey.
Doctor Sutphin, is your wife mental?
You think the kids are awake?
We could be very quiet.
Oh, honey! You're hot tonight!
Oh, yeah!
Honey, I'm ready!
"Oo-ee! Oo-ee! Oo-ee! Oo-ee! Oo-ee!"

[as Beverly hits Mrs. Jenson a final time]
REWIND!
If mom's psycho, Scotty will still be okay, won't he?
We hope so, son. And no matter what your mother is, we'll love her anyway.
I'm stood up! I'll kill that bastard! I mean it, he should be dead that lousy creep! He told me he'd be here! I'll kill him!
Umm, don't use words unless you mean them, Misty.
You know, you're bigger than Freddy and Jason now, only you're a real person.
Hey, can I borrow your mother? My Aunt is coming for dinner and she's always getting on my nerves.
Buckle up, Scotty!
[uses aerosol can and lighter to create flamethrower]

[on fire]
No, Mrs. Sutphin, please. I'll wear my seatbelt.
Are you okay, Ralph?
Mrs. Sterner, please stay in the waiting room.

[about Eugene]
Help me, Betty, he's worse than the dentist in "Marathon Man".

[chanting]
Serial mom! Serial mom! Serial mom! Serial mom!

[to Chip, Birdie & Jimmy]
I don't know what it is about today but I feel great. Cookie?

[about "Blood Feast"]
The "Citizen Kane" of gore movies.

[to Detective Pike]
Christ, that was Beaver Cleaver's mother.
Officer, I'm sorry, but we don't allow gum in this house.
Sorry, ma'am.
Serial Mom is headed south on Keswick. Proceed with caution. She is armed and fuckin' nuts!
I should warn you. This note contains, uh, language.
Oh, my.
I don't like to read about movies. They're so violent.
Bingo, boys! Bust the bitch!
Dad, you don't think she did it, do you?
I do! Mom's gone crazy.
Your mother may have some problems. That's all.
[first lines]
That's a nice dress you're wearing this morning, Misty.
Thanks.
Did you bring back "Ghost Dad"?
There ya go.
[handing over video]
I just love Bill Cosby pictures!
Wear your seatbelt!
[stabs at Scott's car]

[in court to Chip and Misty]
Oh, kids, are you doing your homework?

[to Eugene, Misty and Chip]
It's been a crazy day hasn't it?
